STM: Struggling with the workload of college courses, especially in Computer Science and Calculus
Feeling overwhelmed by the fast pace and high expectations of college life

MTM.Summary: Struggling with the demands of college coursework.
MTM.Patterns: Difficulty with Computer Science, Calculus, high expectations
MTM.Goals: Improve time management, seek academic help
MTM.Transition: Transitioning from high school to college life.

short_term: Complete all required coursework with at least a B average
Attend tutoring sessions for Computer Science and Calculus
long_term: Secure an internship in a tech-related field
Develop proficiency in at least two programming languages

STM: Made a couple of friends in class, finding some comfort in social connections
Feeling disconnected from high school friends due to the rapid change in lifestyle

MTM.Summary: Navigating social connections in a new environment.
MTM.Patterns: Making new friends, feeling disconnected from old friends
MTM.Goals: Build new relationships, maintain old ones
MTM.Transition: Adapting to the rapid change in lifestyle.

LTM.Lessons: New environments offer new opportunities, change is inevitable

short_term: Join at least two campus clubs or groups
Schedule weekly calls with family and old friends
long_term: Build a supportive network of friends and mentors
Cultivate meaningful long-term relationships

STM: Experiencing the stress of college life, including early mornings and late-night disturbances
Dealing with existential thoughts and feelings of not belonging

MTM.Summary: Feeling stressed by college life and existential concerns.
MTM.Patterns: Stress from workload, existential thoughts, feeling out of place
MTM.Goals: Manage stress, find a sense of belonging
MTM.Transition: Adjusting to new responsibilities and self-identity.

LTM.Implications: Recognizing the importance of mental health.
LTM.Lessons: Self-care is essential, seek support when needed

short_term: Practice mindfulness or meditation daily
Find a counselor or therapist for regular sessions
long_term: Develop a sustainable routine for physical and mental health
Achieve a balanced lifestyle that includes time for relaxation and hobbies

STM: Realization of the high cost of living in NYC, particularly with expenses like coffee
Feeling broke due to the demands of college life and urban living

MTM.Summary: Realizing the high cost of living in NYC.

short_term: Create and stick to a monthly budget
Apply for scholarships or part-time jobs
long_term: Save enough for a semester abroad or summer program
Begin investing in a retirement fund

STM: Questioning if anyone is truly happy or just pretending
Feeling like college isn't matching up to the expectations of freedom and fun

MTM.Summary: Questioning societal norms and personal expectations.
MTM.Patterns: Doubt about happiness, mismatch between expectations and reality
MTM.Transition: Shifting from idealism to realism in college life.

LTM.Implications: Acknowledging the complexity of personal fulfillment.
LTM.Lessons: Happiness is subjective, societal norms can be questioned

short_term: Read at least one book on philosophy or personal development each month
Journal weekly about personal growth and philosophical insights
long_term: Develop a personal philosophy that guides life choices
Contribute to discussions or writings on societal norms and personal fulfillment

STM: Frustrated with coding assignments, particularly in Java
Struggling to find enjoyment in programming

MTM.Patterns: Frustration with Java, lack of enjoyment in programming
MTM.Goals: Improve coding skills, find motivation in tech
MTM.Transition: Moving from enthusiasm to frustration in tech learning.

short_term: Complete a small coding project outside of coursework
Attend coding workshops or hackathons
long_term: Gain a solid understanding of software development principles
Create or contribute to an open-source project

STM: Expressing desire to get an internship at Jane Street through networking
Feeling like an outsider in a new environment, possibly due to career-related insecurities

MTM.Summary: Pursuing an internship and navigating college coursework.
MTM.Patterns: Networking, feeling like an outsider, difficulty with CS, high expectations
MTM.Goals: Secure internship, improve time management, seek academic help
MTM.Transition: Transitioning from high school to college life and career aspirations.

short_term: Secure a paid internship in tech or related field
Improve coding skills through practice and courses
Engage in career development workshops or seminars
long_term: Obtain a full-time job in the tech industry
Gain leadership experience in a professional setting
Pursue a graduate degree or advanced certifications

STM: Ran into a high school friend, reflecting on how people change
Awkward interaction with roommate; considering socializing more or staying in
First date with a classmate went well, planning for a second date
Feeling butterflies before the next date, indicating excitement or nervousness

MTM.Summary: Navigating new and old relationships in a changing environment.
MTM.Patterns: Meeting old friends, awkward roommate interactions, dating excitement
MTM.Goals: Build new relationships, maintain old ones, find social balance
MTM.Transition: Adapting to the rapid change in lifestyle and social dynamics.

LTM.Lessons: New environments offer new opportunities, change is inevitable, social balance is key

short_term: Strengthen bonds with college friends through shared activities
Resolve conflicts with roommates or find a more compatible living situation
Attend social events to meet new people
long_term: Maintain long-term friendships from college
Develop a supportive network of friends and colleagues
Establish a balance between personal and professional life

STM: Struggling with the heat in the city
Concerns about the health impact of revolving life around deadlines

MTM.Summary: Struggling with stress and environmental challenges.
MTM.Patterns: Stress from workload, existential thoughts, feeling out of place, heat struggles
MTM.Goals: Manage stress, find belonging, adapt to environment
MTM.Transition: Adjusting to new responsibilities, self-identity, and physical conditions.

LTM.Implications: Recognizing the importance of mental health.
LTM.Lessons: Self-care is essential, seek support when needed, balance is crucial

short_term: Implement stress management techniques like meditation or yoga
Seek counseling or support groups for college stress
Develop a regular sleep schedule
long_term: Adopt a sustainable lifestyle promoting physical and mental health
Cultivate resilience against life's pressures
Maintain a consistent routine of exercise and relaxation

STM: Hearing about blockchain and crypto for the first time
Expressing interest in crypto investment and seeking advice
Learning about trading and its mind-blowing aspects
Interest in NFTs and their potential impact on digital art

MTM.Summary: Exploring new investment avenues and managing living costs.
MTM.Patterns: Interest in crypto, learning trading, managing NYC expenses
MTM.Goals: Budgeting, seeking financial aid, exploring investment opportunities
MTM.Transition: Learning to manage finances independently and exploring investment.

short_term: Create and adhere to a personal budget
Apply for scholarships or financial aid
Start a small investment portfolio with low-risk assets
long_term: Achieve financial independence
Build a diverse investment portfolio
Plan for long-term financial stability like retirement or major purchases

STM: Feeling like an outsider or not belonging in current environment
Reflecting on personal growth and the fast pace of life changes

MTM.Summary: Reflecting on personal growth and societal norms.
MTM.Patterns: Feeling like an outsider, reflecting on change, doubt about happiness
MTM.Goals: Find personal purpose, redefine success, understand self
MTM.Transition: Shifting from idealism to realism in college life and personal growth.

LTM.Implications: Acknowledging the complexity of personal fulfillment.
LTM.Lessons: Happiness is subjective, societal norms can be questioned, personal growth is continuous

short_term: Explore different philosophical perspectives through reading or discussions
Set personal values and align actions with them
Reflect regularly on personal growth and life satisfaction
long_term: Develop a personal philosophy that guides life decisions
Contribute to philosophical discourse or community
Achieve a deeper understanding of self and purpose

STM: Overhearing discussions on blockchain and crypto without understanding them
Curious about Ethereum, though prefers Rust for projects
Learning about blockchain integration into gaming

MTM.Summary: Exploring new technologies and struggling with coding.
MTM.Patterns: Curiosity about blockchain, learning about trading, frustration with Java
MTM.Goals: Improve coding skills, find motivation in tech, explore new tech
MTM.Transition: Moving from enthusiasm to frustration in tech learning, exploring new tech areas.

short_term: Participate in hackathons or coding challenges
Learn a new programming language or framework
Experiment with blockchain technology or other emerging tech
long_term: Become proficient in multiple programming languages
Innovate or contribute to the tech industry
Stay updated with technological advancements and adapt accordingly
